course_name: Western Religious Thought from the Middle Ages to the Present
description: An examination of the principal ideas, contributions to important debates, and the place in contemporary religious thought of twelve famous thinkers. Further, the questions raised concerning the theism/atheism debate by the thinking of the twelve subjects will be discussed. The thought of influential figures such as Luther, Hume, Kant, Nietzsche, Simone Weil, Paul Tillich, and Karl Barth will be covered.
